course.title: CompTIA Security+
audience: Individuals preparing for CompTIA Security+ certification
course.prerequisites: Basic understanding of networking and IT fundamentals or completion of CompTIA Network+ certification.

modules.title: Threats & Vulnerabilities
modules.description: This module covers common cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and mitigation strategies, including malware, phishing, social engineering, and insider threats.

sections.title: Malware and Phishing
sections.overview: Malware includes viruses, ransomware, and spyware; phishing targets user credentials.
examples: Ransomware: WannaCry encrypts files for ransom.
Phishing: Fake login pages steal credentials.

sections.title: Social Engineering Techniques
sections.overview: Techniques like pretexting, baiting, and tailgating exploit human trust.
examples: Pretexting: Impersonating IT staff to gain access.
Tailgating: Following authorized personnel into secure areas.

sections.title: Risk Types and Threat Actors
sections.overview: Risks include internal and external threats; actors range from script kiddies to nation-states.
examples: Insider Threat: Disgruntled employee leaking data.

sections.title: Common Vulnerabilities and Mitigation
sections.overview: Vulnerabilities like unpatched systems or weak passwords are mitigated through updates and policies.
examples: Vulnerability: SQL injection in web applications.

modules.title: Network & Infrastructure Security
modules.description: This module explores securing network infrastructure using protocols, segmentation, firewalls, and wireless security techniques.

sections.title: Secure Protocols
sections.overview: Protocols like HTTPS and SSH ensure secure communication.

sections.title: Network Segmentation and VPNs
sections.overview: Segmentation isolates networks; VPNs secure remote connections.

sections.title: Firewalls and Proxies
sections.overview: Firewalls filter traffic; proxies control access.

sections.title: Wireless Security
sections.overview: WPA3 and EAP secure wireless networks.

modules.title: Identity & Access Management (IAM)
modules.description: This module covers authentication, access control models, identity federation, and directory services for secure access management.

sections.title: Authentication Methods
sections.overview: Methods like MFA, biometrics, and SSO verify user identity.

sections.title: Identity Federation and Lifecycle
sections.overview: Federation enables cross-organization access; lifecycle manages user accounts.

sections.title: Access Control Models
sections.overview: RBAC and ABAC define access based on roles or attributes.

sections.title: Directory Services and Identity Providers
sections.overview: Services like LDAP and IdPs manage user identities.
examples: LDAP: Active Directory for user management.

modules.title: Cryptography & PKI
modules.description: This module covers encryption, hashing, digital signatures, and public key infrastructure for securing data and communications.

sections.title: Encryption Types
sections.overview: Symmetric and asymmetric encryption secure data.

sections.title: Hashing and Salting
sections.overview: Hashing ensures data integrity; salting strengthens passwords.
examples: Salting: Random data for password hashing.

sections.title: Certificates and Key Management
sections.overview: Certificates and PKI manage secure communications.

sections.title: Crypto Attacks and Secure Protocols
sections.overview: Attacks like brute force target weak encryption; secure protocols mitigate risks.
examples: Attack: Brute force on weak keys.

modules.title: Governance, Risk, Ops & Exam Prep

sections.overview: Policies define security practices and compliance requirements.
examples: Acceptable Use Policy: Governs device usage.
Incident Response Plan: Guides breach response.

sections.title: Frameworks, Laws, and Compliance
sections.overview: Frameworks like NIST and laws like GDPR ensure compliance.

hands_on_labs: Configure a firewall rule to block unauthorized traffic.
Set up a VPN for secure remote access.
Implement MFA on a test account using an IdP.
Scan a network using Nmap to identify open ports.
Analyze a sample incident response plan and suggest improvements.
resources: CompTIA Security+ Study Guide (SY0-601 or later).
OWASP Top Ten for application security.
Sample practice exams and command-line tools provided in course materials.
additional_notes.environment: Access to a virtual lab environment or sandbox for network and security tool practice.
